intro: Pedicularis przewalskii, commonly known as the Przewalski's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
